Label: International
Description: The language is widely used between nations in trade, knowledge exchange, and international policy.

Label: National
Description: The language is used in education, work, mass media, and government at the national level.

Label: Provincial
Description: The language is used in education, work, mass media, and government within major administrative subdivisions of a nation.

Label: Wider Communication
Description: The language is used in work and mass media without official status to transcend language differences across a region.

Label: Educational
Description: The language is in vigorous use, with standardization and literature being sustained through a widespread system of institutionally supported education.

Label: Developing
Description: The language is in vigorous use, with literature in a standardized form being used by some though this is not yet widespread or sustainable.

Label: Vigorous
Description: The language is used for face-to-face communication by all generations and the situation is sustainable.

Label: Threatened
Description: The language is used for face-to-face communication within all generations, but it is losing users.

Label: Shifting
Description: The child-bearing generation can use the language among themselves, but it is not being transmitted to children.

Label: Moribund
Description: The only remaining active users of the language are members of the grandparent generation and older.

Label: Nearly Extinct
Description: The only remaining users of the language are members of the grandparent generation or older who have little opportunity to use the language.

Label: Dormant
Description: The language serves as a reminder of heritage identity for an ethnic community, but no one has more than symbolic proficiency.

Label: Extinct
Description: The language is no longer used and no one retains a sense of ethnic identity associated with the language.
